Question: In 1947, at age 17, this person began studying aeronautical engineering at Purdue University.
Hints: Use of this person's name, image, and famous quote caused him problems over the years.
This person's first flight in a rocket plane was on August 15, 1957, in the Bell X-1B, to an altitude of 11.4 miles (18.3 km).
At the bottom of the ladder, this person said "I'm going to step off the LEM now" (referring to the Apollo Lunar Module).
